results.title: Something to hide
results.brief_description: Harry Field’s (Peter Finch) life is turned into a nightmare when he offers a hitch-hiker (Linda Hayden) a lift. His problems are exacerbated by marital problems and alcoholism. Also starring Shelley Winters, Colin Blakely, John Stride and Linda Hayden. Also known as “Shattered” and based on the book by Nicholas Monsarrat.

results.title: Pirates of Spring Cove
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Alan Brown and Duota Rentals
results.brief_description: Hayley Mills and John Mills star in this family pleaser that has adventure, piracy, buried treasure and romance. An American widower and his 18 year old daughter live on a Caribbean houseboat. When they invite the nephew of a millionaire to join them on their voyage, romance and action hop on board too. The nephew’s former business partner arrives and together they embark on a dive to discover buried treasure. James MacArthur (Hawaii Five-O) co stars. Also known as “The Truth about Spring”, after Hayley Mills’ character, Spring Tyler.

results.title: The Dead zone
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Debra Hill, Columbia Pictures and Rastar Productions
results.brief_description: Faithfully adapted from the Stephen King novel of the same name, this is the chilling story of a man who wakes up from a five-year coma with the extraordinary power to see visions of the past, present and, most frightening, the future. A tense and thought provoking production in which Walken gives one of his most intense and believable performances.

results.title: The Stepfather
results.creator_credit: Joseph Ruben, Jay Benson and ITC Productions
results.brief_description: Terry O’Quinn is “the Stepfather”, the man with the generic name because he has been a stepfather many times. He also has a gruesome way of ending relationships and severing the family ties; he kills them when they fail to meet his perfect standards and moves on to the next family. Shelley Hack and Jill Schoelen are cast as his latest victims.

results.title: The Big lift
results.creator_credit: George Seaton and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Montgomery Clift and Paul Douglas star in this reenactment of the Berlin airlift of 1948 which occurred as a result of a Russian blockade of the western sector; refusing to allow the Allies to ship food supplies to starving Berliners. An airlift proves to be the only solution. Paul Douglas stars as ground operations sergeant Frank Kowalski, and Montgomery Clift as pilot Danny MacCullough, both of whom have differing views on the matter. Cornell Borchers features as a love interest.

results.title: Red house
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Col Lesser and JEF Films
results.brief_description: What is the macabre secret of the terrifying Red House? Hidden deep within the spooky Oxhead Woods, it guards hidden mysteries of the dark past - puzzlements of passions and torture that threaten to surface and shatter innocent lives. Highlighted by atmospheric photography and a clever script, superb acting from Edward G. Robinson, Lon McCallister and Judith Anderson, with eerie blood-chilling music, this film is a blockbuster of a suspense thriller you will not soon forget.

results.title: Talk radio
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho, Edward Pressman and Cineplex Odeon
results.brief_description: Based on the book “Talked to death: the life and murder of Alan Berg” by Stephen Singular, this film presents an often unseen side of talk radio of paranoia and passion. Eric Bogosian (who also wrote the play based on Singular’s book) stars as a contentious talk show host. He pushes the boundaries of political correctness and inspires emotions of love or hate from his listeners. His provocative broadcasts push one caller too far, leading to dire consequences. Also starring Alec Baldwin, Ellen Greene and John Pankow.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho, Edward Pressman and Cineplex Odeon

results.title: Hit
results.creator_credit: Sidney J. Furie, Harry Korshak and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A special ‘hit’ team, consisting of 7 individuals are recruited for a death defying mission of revenge. Each has their own motivation for blood lust. They are led by a vigilante federal agent Nick Allen, played by Billy Dee Williams, who is motivated by seeking revenge against drug dealers for the death of his daughter. The location is Marseilles as they close in on the drug syndicate. Also starring Richard Pryor, Paul Hampton and Gwen Welles.

results.title: The Girl who spelled freedom
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, R.W. Goodwin and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Based on newspaper articles and personal interviews with Linn Yann, this moving film tells of one young Cambodian girl refugees experiences in America and her fight to be accepted. With the support of her caring American sponsors (played by Mary Kay Place and Wayne Rogers), Linn Yann (Jade Chinn) overcomes the strangeness of her new country and makes a name for herself by winning the regional spelling competition, thus bringing attention to the plight of other refugees like her.

results.title: The Black book = Reign of terror
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mann, William Cameron Menzies and JEF Films
results.brief_description: The title of this film refers to the book naming the individuals the sadistic ruler of France during the Revolution, Robespierre (Richard Basehart), plans to execute by guillotine. Charles D’Aubigny (Robert Cummings), is enlisted by a group of political moderates to try and retrieve the book and expose Robespierre’s corruption. Also starring Arlene Dahl, Richard Hart, Arnold Moss and Beulah Bondi. The film is also known as “Reign of terror”.
